comment: ACMeasurement schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Energy/master/ACMeasurement/schema.json
description: The Data Model intended to measure the electrical energies consumed by an electrical system which uses an Alternating Current (AC) for a three-phase (L1, L2, L3) or single-phase (L) and neutral (N). It integrates the initial version of the data Modem [THREEPHASEMEASUREMENT], extended to also perform single-phase measurements. It includes attributes for various electrical measurements such as power, frequency, current and voltage.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateEnergyMeteringStarted
contents.comment: The starting date for metering energy in an ISO8601 UTC format.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateObservedFrom
contents.comment: Observation period: Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the `dateObserved` attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.

contents.name: dateObservedTo
contents.comment: Observation period: End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the `dateObserved` attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: frequency
contents.comment: The frequency of the circuit. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: totalActiveEnergyExport
contents.comment: Total energy imported i.e. consumed . The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalActiveEnergyImport
contents.comment: Total energy imported i.e. consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalActivePower
contents.comment: Total Active Power consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalApparentEnergyExport
contents.comment: Total energy exported (with regards to apparent power). The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalApparentEnergyImport
contents.comment: Total energy imported i.e. consumed (with regards to apparent power). The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalApparentPower
contents.comment: Total Apparent Power consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalDisplacementPowerFactor
contents.comment: Sum of Displacement power factor including all phases. The quantity is based on the fundamental frequency of the system.

contents.name: totalPowerFactor
contents.comment: Sum of Power factor including all phases.

contents.name: totalReactiveEnergyExport
contents.comment: Total fundamental frequency reactive energy exported. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalReactiveEnergyImport
contents.comment: Total energy imported i.e. consumed (with regards to fundamental frequency reactive power). The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: totalReactivePower
contents.comment: Total Reactive Power consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: refDevice
contents.comment: Reference to the devices which captured this observation

contents.name: refTargetDevice
contents.comment: Reference to a list of the devices for which the measurement was taken

contents.name: activeEnergyExport
contents.comment: Active energy exported per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: activeEnergyImport
contents.comment: Active energy imported i.e. consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: activePower
contents.comment: Active power consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address

contents.name: apparentEnergyExport
contents.comment: Apparent energy exported per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: apparentEnergyImport
contents.comment: Apparent energy imported i.e. consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: apparentPower
contents.comment: Apparent power consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: current
contents.comment: Electrical current. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: displacementPowerFactor
contents.comment: Displacement power factor for each phase. The quantity is based on the fundamental frequency of the system.

contents.name: phaseToPhaseVoltage
contents.comment: Voltage between phases. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: phaseVoltage
contents.comment: The voltage between each phase and neutral conductor. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: powerFactor
contents.comment: Power factor for each phase.

contents.name: reactiveEnergyExport
contents.comment: Fundamental frequency reactive energy exported per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: reactiveEnergyImport
contents.comment: Fundamental frequency reactive energy imported i.e. consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: reactivePower
contents.comment: Fundamental frequency reactive power. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes)

contents.name: thdCurrent
contents.comment: Total harmonic distortion of current for each phase.

contents.name: thdVoltage
contents.comment: Total harmonic distortion of voltage for each phase.
